If you're looking for stories about war and thinking, "The Lucky Ones" (2008) starring Mark L. Young and John Heard might be up your alley. This poignant and heartwarming film explores the challenges faced by soldiers returning home from war. 

If you're interested in stories about the human impact of war, "The Best Years of Our Lives" (1946) starring Myrna Loy and Myrna Loy is a must-watch. This poignant film tells the story of three World War II veterans dealing with the challenges of war and their subsequent return home.

If you're interested in stories about the complexities of war and its aftermath, "Kundun" (1997) starring Tenzin Thuthob Tsarong and Tencho Gyalpo is a poignant and powerful film. This film chronicles the struggles of the fourteenth Dalai Lama in dealing with Chinese oppression and other challenges.

"Fury" (2014) starring Jim Parrack, Brad Pitt, and Logan Lerman is a thrilling and intense war film that captures the horrors and brutality of the war in Europe.
